1604065853_mirrored_virl_github.body: Maybe publish the android version on the F-Droid store already for the, ones who use custom ROMs or where Google Play is blocked.
Maybe a react-native version. It can compile to iOS and Android

1604066347_mirrored_Serkan-devel_github.body: Maybe compress above a certain file size
Maybe look at Brotlin compression. It's even more efficient than gzip but only works over https

1604066349_mirrored_Serkan-devel_github.body: `python2 zeronet.py --ui_ip *` doesn't seem to work (I'm running it on a raspberry pi)

1604067052_mirrored_Serkan-devel_github.body:
I thought ZeroNet can be python packaged already, but there is a `setup.py`-file missing for doing so https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/382 .

That way, one could have pointed to the `requirements.txt`-file to manage all dependencies.

Sorry for letting you wait long for nothing

topic.title: Server-side compression
topic.body: Implementing server-side compression could lower down the bandwidth usage a little. File verification could happen after decompression.

topic.title: How to ZeroNet on LAN
topic.body: Is it possible to access ZeroNet on the same network, other than localhost?
